storyInfo: Secunda learns unexpected details about the missing data scientist, shedding new light on the case. The battlefield situation has suddenly shifted, and despite their lingering doubts, the three Abyssal Hunters become part of the Waterway Program at Consul Clementia's behest, formally joining the battle.

attributes.text: Valeria has been back for half a month now, but I fear the package from Talos may never arrive. Those precious prototype technologies and biological specimens were lost, along with the civilian-grade environmental simulation unit I ordered.
No notification, no incident report. The cosmos simply slammed the door in our faces without warning.

Poor Mother. She must endure the life pod a few days longer. This may be selfish, but I was the one to insist on bidding her farewell in a simulated environment. Until the moment she entered hibernation, she wanted to see her grandchildren. How could I tell her the grandchildren she envisioned simply do not exist?
No doubt she still dwells in that glorious age where we journeyed among the stars. It's the only way she could see that continuing life doesn’t just add to the pain.

I chose Talos Union Industries' products for their reliability. Mother's too sharp. If the simulation tech was even a generation older, she'd see right through it. I should have realized the risks of interstellar transport sooner.

Valeria's leave is all used up. As she left, she was still talking about her grand mission, showing not a single sign of regret. I don't know if she was leaving her regrets behind, or never had any in the first place.
One day, I too will sign my name on the consent form, and shut down Mother's life pod.

attributes.content: What brings you here?
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: I came to see you.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: You've just undergone embryo separation surgery. The Institute of Facility Management should have allowed you to take time off to rest.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: The surgery is as non-invasive as it gets, you know. There's no need to rest that long.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: I can't tell whether you care more about me or the little fellow in the incubation chamber, Magister Avitus.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: Of course I care about you, but any newborn in Ægir as it is now deserves attention as well.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: After he's born, will you choose to raise him personally, or give him to the Institute of Incubation?
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: I don't think about that sort of thing. It's too far away, too distant.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: I went to the hospital before I came here.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: The hospital? Why?
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: You're aware of the battle yesterday, yes? Surely you've seen the news?
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: Two fleets and over a thousand legionnaires went into battle, but only twenty-six returned.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: The Waterway Program is at a turning point, and Milliarium has endured its greatest sacrifice since its departure. There have also been quite a few abnormalities in the city as of late.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: What is it you're trying to say?
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: The Sea Patrol are already looking for you, aren't they, Cassia?
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: About that missing data scientist.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: Magister Avitus.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: You know, of all the documents in your collection, the one I like the most is 'The Death of Life.' Despite its lack of scholarly value.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: I only ever found that diary by accident.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: More than three hundred years ago, four great researchers studying the prehistoric civilization made incredible discoveries in the mantle ruins, bringing back countless precious technologies and data to Ægir.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: Compared to all those blueprints and theoretical papers, a transcript of voice-recorded diary is hardly worth anything.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: And so it gathered dust in the Academy of Science's databases. Until, thanks to your curiosity, it was deciphered and turned into a popular reading material.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: Merely the musings of an ordinary Predecessor on his endless journey.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: But I loved the story of that Predecessor.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: I enjoyed seeing reality through his eyes.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: How the connections between countless stars collapsed, how the trust between myriad races crumbled away. Goods were in short supply, technology was lost, philosophy and art fell silent...
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: No matter how much hope and vision went into their great undertakings, they ultimately faded into silence... Just like those nanomachines interred within the beacon tower.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: Did you empathize with his despair, Cassia?
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: You've never shown a trace of that emotion, though. You even chose to have a child born into a world that could face ruin at any moment.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: That isn't the choice of someone who's lost all hope.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: I don't feel a shred of despair. Really.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: That old-fashioned, dispirited, middle-aged man... It's hard to imagine how I could empathize with him at all.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: I simply appreciated how, by borrowing from his past experiences, you ingeniously tore apart the magnificent facade covering the eyes of today's Ægir.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: 'We must accept that the things and qualities we were once so proud of have no use now. Perhaps they have always been flawed, and this calamity merely exposed them.'
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: Once free of worry over survival, people will begin to consider 'value.' We pray that our thoughts, our deeds, even our very existence will have value.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: Every one of Ægir's systems is designed around unearthing that value within people.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: However, value is fragile. You need only look at it from another angle, and the mighty will become the tiny. The hideous, the beautiful.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: It's a pity that, whether through apathy or inertia, people tend to not change viewpoints they are familiar with.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: And so, people live on their immutable value. Were those values to crumble away, they would crumble alongside them.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: Exactly.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: When did despair begin to blossom in you? Was it when Milliarium left the home territories? Or even earlier, after the passing of one close to you?
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: ...Cassia?
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: I'm merely grateful that you came to see me today.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: You reminded me that I still have things to do, and time runs short.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: I'm surprised you allowed such pessimism to spread in your city, Clementia.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: 'The Death of Life,' a prehistoric diary collated and published by Avitus. The year it was released, it proved to be incredibly popular among the citizens.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: They wanted a peek into an unfamiliar life. A thirst born from boredom and idiocy.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: What you just said would be enough to trigger controversy in any nation on the land, Gladiia.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: A tiny piece that implies exhaustion and despair with every line. It tells the story of how a once glorious civilization hit a dead end far more vividly than any raw data.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: And in today's Ægir, can it really be considered an 'unfamiliar life'?
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Ægir may be the prehistoric civilization's heir, but that does not require its subservience. We need not condone the rise of... 'exhaustion and despair.'
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Ægir stands unwavering due to its unbreakable rationality.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: It is our rationality that allows us to be aware of our possible destruction, perhaps even one of all humanity.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Even those who have fallen, detestable as they are, at times make choices based on long-term examination and cautious reflection.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: You have personally executed no small number of cultists in your days in the Legions.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Just as you had to personally execute any Hunters who ran wild. You and I are both burdened with heavy duties that we cannot rely on sentimentality.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Was it this rationality that led you to hastily throw the Hunters into the battle for the Waterway Program, despite their recent return?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Kal'tsit...
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: I invite the two of you to look at the beacon tower behind us. It was once an important component of the interstellar expedition our ancestors planned for.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Within the tower lie countless nanomachines. The first Ægir city to break through the electron cloud would have seeded them throughout the sea of stars.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: They would self-proliferate, self-repair, and connect together into an ever bright road network. With this, our fleets would have been able to jump freely between the stars.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: After the outbreak of the Seaborn crisis, Ægir turned its eyes from the stars, and the bio-energy system requiring support from a dozen or so cities was cut off.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: The nanomachines were incompatible with other energy sources, so after losing their specialized source, they all 'died' within that tower.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: But our colleagues from the Academy of Technology have helped alter this tower to serve us in a different manner, by lighting our paths.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Since Milliarium left the home territories, it has been continuously marking Seaborn nests. Huge volumes of data are now compiled within that tower's control center.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: With the precise locations of these Seaborn nests, our Class IV weapons can destroy the primary nest in any targeted area of ocean, driving away the occupying Seaborn.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: This will clear a path of pure water leading back to the home territories. One that can support a Waterway our main forces can pass through.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Perhaps the Seaborn will eventually regroup, but at the very least, their accumulated nutrients will rot away in their absence, and any re-established nests will bear no fruit.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: You are lecturing us on the core concept of the 'Waterway Program,' Madame Consul.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Yes I am, Doctor.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: The Abyssal Hunters only managed to save twenty-six lives in yesterday's battle. The Seaborn were clearly forewarned.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Between the oceanic interior and the continental shelf, this city has been fighting them for far too long. They are now adapting to Class III weapons at a much faster rate.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Nest 37's position is of particular import. It strangles the throat of the Waterway. Abandoning it would mean stumbling at the final hurdle.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: This is our final battle before the Waterway can be opened. We must gather all the force we can bear as part of the program. The Abyssal Hunters are no exception.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Even if they have only just arrived home.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Can Ægir ensure their safe return?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: New combat teams are being formed as we speak. They will confront the Seaborn directly, and create an opportunity for the Hunters to enter the nest and deploy the beacon.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: But, as you know, these are merely routine tactics. I am... unable to offer a guarantee.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: In that case...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I know what you are worried about. Be at ease.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: The Hunters are responsible for their own safety, as well as the risks they face.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: As this is a joint decision by you two Chief Designers of Warfare, I am unopposed, but I will not withdraw my objections.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Gladiia...
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: An unbecoming sentimentality bubbles up in Clementia's throat.
She wants to convey her guilt. Her remorse. Her regret.
She wants to give Gladiia one last hug, just like how she welcomed her back on her return.
But she cannot.
Gladiia.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Advisor Blandus has made preparations for your organic regeneration surgery. You should make your own before the procedure.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Doña Irene!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Jordi.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: You were gone for a whole day...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I was investigating a few things with the Sea Patrol. I also went on a trip into the ocean. I didn't enjoy it very much, so don't ask.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Alright then.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: What about you? What have you been up to?
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: It's not unusual to feel some discomfort. Cheer up, Jordi, this is your homeland.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: (Chuckles wryly)
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Judging by your expression, you've already studied Breogan's data?
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: The young Ægir somehow nods his head while also shaking it.
I'm not 100% sure, but there seems to be no real relation between me and that great naval architect.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: What does that matter?
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Uncle Thiago hoped I'd leave Gran Faro, leave Iberia, but he never told me where to go...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I'm Ægir, so Ægir is where I should be.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: But people need some sort of concrete connection, even just a name or some notes, to truly trace their family history.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Avitus said that even though the Seaborn crisis has been raging for over two hundred years, Ægir still has a hundred or more cities comparable in size to Milliarium.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: If I'm not Breogan's descendant, then which city did my grandparents live in before they became Islanders? Or was it one of the ones that's gone now?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: What kind of work did they do? How did they live? In the end, who were they?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Sorry, you don't need to hear all this. You've just arrived here yourself, but you're already assisting the Sea Patrol with their investigation. While I'm just...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: You've got nerves of steel.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I'm just an Iberian who can't do a thing here.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Dr. Kal'tsit is in charge of negotiations with the leader of this city, and the Hunters have dived right back into their familiar battle. While my lantern and handcannon aren't especially helpful right now.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Ægir will permit a Liberi to look around its warships and ports, but will not allow her to join the Legions and help fight against the Seaborn. I can't understand that sort of war.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Down here in the depths, all I can do is investigate any abnormal activity within the city. In case it could jeopardize the cooperation between Iberia and Ægir.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Why are you telling me all this?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: My hometown was destroyed in a Catastrophe, Jordi. I don't have many memories of it.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: The scripture I carry is the only connection with it I have left. It saved my life, and in doing became my guide, my faith.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: But when I saw the Inquisition's dungeons, climbed aboard the Stultifera Navis, witnessed my mentor's sacrifice... Only then did I understand what faith was. Accepted its weaknesses. Found its meaning.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: You mean...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I don't have nerves of steel, Jordi. I get lost and confused, too.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: It's just that, more often than not, that confusion becomes a specific issue you have to resolve. One after another, as quickly as you can.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Arresting the cultists. Taking back the lighthouse invaded by the tides. Finding a lost warship out at sea. Aiding an ally in investigating a missing data scientist.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: The 'connection' you're looking for can be anything, whether it's a hometown or faith. Keep looking. You'll find it. It may not be quick or easy, but you'll find it.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Can I really do it?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Can you not?
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: You helped Iberia relight its final lighthouse, and saved three Abyssal Hunters. Didn't Laurentina tell you that that's enough to get a commendation from the consul herself?
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Whether it's as an Ægir or an Inquisition clerk, there are a lot of things you can do.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Praefecta!
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: You're back the city. But... From the look on your face, I take it the investigation didn't go so well, did it?
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: Lucilla?
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: Forgive me, I need to report on my progress to Consul Clementia. I'm not at liberty to divulge any details.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: A-Actually, I was looking for you.
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: There's something I should've remembered back when you were explaining the situation to us. Nothing major, honestly, and it might not even help.
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: But I felt like I had to tell you!
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: ...Go on.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: You're the last researcher left.
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: I'm really, really sorry; can you give me one more hour?
attributes.name: Tullia

attributes.content: Caulerpa archaeosphaeridium, Hypnea fenestralis, Halymenia fimbriatus, Palmaria purpureus, Sargassum pennata... There's not too many left. I'll finish cataloging them real quick!
attributes.name: Tullia

attributes.content: No need to rush, Tullia. I'm just here for a routine inspection.
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: You know who I am?
attributes.name: Tullia

attributes.content: Mhm. We were in the same batch before the transfer assessment by the Institute of Development Planning. You might not remember me, though.
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: Are you preparing to transport these seaweeds?
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: Th-This doesn't violate any protocols, does it?!
attributes.name: Tullia

attributes.content: Calm down. This building's handover procedures are already complete. If you leave the samples and cultivation equipment behind, you'll end up having to pack them away in bulk.
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: Thanks for the warning.
attributes.name: Tullia

attributes.content: But with all these seaweeds, how could you possibly take them all away at once?
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: Now that it's close to land, Milliarium will be undergoing targeted reformation. The city won't have the space or the resources to breed seaweeds.
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: Yeah, I know.
attributes.name: Tullia

attributes.content: I'll take as much as I can. I'll think of something, some way that won't inconvenience anyone.
attributes.name: Tullia

attributes.content: But the base by the volcano is already...
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: That was once Ægir's biggest endangered plants reserve. I saw it get swallowed up by the Seaborn.
attributes.name: Tullia

attributes.content: These primitive seaweeds are some of the simplest, yet most tenacious lifeforms in the entire ocean.
attributes.name: Tullia

attributes.content: Whether in bright shallow seas, the dark abyss, the flat sea floor, or cracks in the cliffs, they stretch out as best they can.
attributes.name: Tullia

attributes.content: And they're as old as the ocean itself, pretty much this planet's living fossils.
attributes.name: Tullia

attributes.content: I'm no legionnaire, and I can't go fight the Seaborn. These remaining seaweeds won't help us solve the Seaborn problem, either.
attributes.name: Tullia

attributes.content: But I can't just let them wither away in here.
attributes.name: Tullia

attributes.content: ...You really love your work, huh Tullia?
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: Um, don't you?
attributes.name: Tullia

attributes.content: Ah, my Little Handy sent over a loading module. Sorry, but I can't stay and chat.
attributes.name: Tullia

attributes.content: Do you need any help?
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: No thanks, I'm fine.
attributes.name: Tullia

attributes.content: When did that happen?
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: The day before the Institute of Ecological Art relocated.
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: I don't know what happened to her after that, and I don't know if she thinks Milliarium abandoned the volcanic power station and the plants reserve...
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: But I can't imagine her doing anything bad because of it... because she's never abandoned anything herself.
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: Tullia's residence had quite a few hydroponic tanks, but they'd been empty for a while...
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: What you just told me might actually be significant, Lucilla.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: But if I may be so bold, why do you care so much about her affairs?
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: From what I've heard, you could hardly be considered friends.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: She...
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: She has something I don't.
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: Okay, I've said what I had to say. I'll be getting back to work now, Praefecta.
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: There's just been more and more happening lately. The maintenance required for the city unit framework has multiplied several-fold, and I'm running out of ink as it is.
attributes.name: Lucilla

attributes.content: Little Handy.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: Praefecta Secunda.
attributes.name: 'Little Handy'

attributes.content: Obtain data on the city of Milliarium from the Institute of Facility Management, right away. Retrieve all locations suitable for enclosed hydroponics.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: Also, contact Irene.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: Tullia may have left other clues within the city. Ask her to meet me as soon as possible.
attributes.name: Secunda
